body_html: Yes. torch.Tensor is always an alias for one of the tensor types, not a "try to infer the datatype" thing. By default it's torch.FloatTensor, but you can change it with torch.set_default_tensor_type
body_text: Yes. torch.Tensor is always an alias for one of the tensor types, not a "try to infer the datatype" thing. By default it's torch.FloatTensor, but you can change it with torch.set_default_tensor_type
body: Yes. `torch.Tensor` is always an alias for one of the tensor types, not a "try to infer the datatype" thing. By default it's `torch.FloatTensor`, but you can change it with `torch.set_default_tensor_type`
